data.title: Invisible mouse cursor can escape window in MM_ABSOLUTE mode
data.body:
Hi,

While further testing out the engine I noticed another issue with it - invisible system mouse cursor in MM_ABSOLUTE mode doesn't actually prevent the mouse from escaping the window.

**Test machine:**
AMD Athlon 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 3800+, NVIDIA GeForce 7600 GT (OpenGL 2.1.2) running on 64-bit Fedora 22 with propertiary NVIDIA 304.125 driver, Urho3D 1.4.
**Steps to reproduce:**
Set mouse mode to MM_ABSOLUTE, set mouse visibility to false, move the mouse aggressively until it escapes. (using tiny window makes it easier)
**Workaround:**
Use MM_RELATIVE mouse mode.
**Proposed fix:**
Deprecate SetMouseVisible() recommending the use of MM_RELATIVE instead, or use some under-the-hood magic not letting invisible cursor leave the window in MM_ABSOLUTE mode.

Once again, thanks for making and providing support for the engine! Keep up the good work!

data.title: Shadows are noticeably off
data.body:
Hi,

While testing out the engine I came across an issue with shadow mapping - the shadows are (very) noticeably off, giving a feeling the objects float on air.

This bug is exposed in every 3D C++ example of Urho3D which uses shadows, as well as my own code. I suppose it is caused by some sort of wrong handling of my totallynotancient NVIDIA GeForce 7600 GT (OpenGL 2.1.2) graphics card running on Fedora 22 with the proprietary NVIDIA 304.125 driver, and as so I attached some screenshots:
![screen1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1766353/8763931/f10ed5d8-2db5-11e5-8760-e117c5c533af.png)
![screen2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1766353/8763932/f10f8852-2db5-11e5-939e-5949063abd76.png)

Huge thanks for making and providing support for such awesome game engine!

data.title: [Request/Question] Import FBX for static mesh & skeletal & animations
data.body:
Is possible or already is here something to Import FBX files for static, skeletal and animations ?
Because i only see something about Ogre like system ? and will be good to have a generic system working like in UE4 or Unity

data.title: Jft editor modifications
data.body:
Some minor tweaks to the editor for more Blender like behavior
- center on selected object using HOME key
- setting for MMB to pan, and use MMB + SHIFT to rotate (currently works the opposite way)

Blender used to be MMB for pan, MMB+SHIFT to rotate for years. Then a couple years ago they switched it around. So the current editor matches fine, but for those of use who (greatly) prefer the original way, that is what this feature is for.

data.title: Internationalization
data.body: Any suggestions?

data.title: FullScreen lost context bug
data.body:
This is opengl / linux.
- I set the graphics on Start() to fullscreen.
- I create the scene, an get a context lost error
- The context recovers and sets the resolution to the max resolution (probably the first in the list)

The issue here is that the resolution gets forgotten and uses the default.

data.title: [Feature request] CatmullRom spline path component where path lays through set of knots
data.body: Current SplinePath do not go through knots, that why I think that we need additional another component that do almost same but path lay through each knot. In future it may used by UI for animation curves in editor.

data.title: OpenGL multi-context support
data.body: Urho3D now properly supports multiple contexts with OpenGL. This now resembles the behavior allowed by DX9/DX11, in that a single process or thread can create and manage multiple Urho3D contexts.

data.title: Terrain blend issue on Android
data.body:
Since 1.4, terrain blending seems to be broken on Android:
![device-2015-07-04-104122](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6427048/8507270/138bf0ae-223b-11e5-93c1-c383ee9e0342.png)
![device-2015-07-04-104508](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6427048/8507271/138e632a-223b-11e5-839a-e6d5df8f375c.png)
Top is current, bottom is before 1.4 (screenshots taken at init, top view, from sample 19_VehicleDemo).

data.title: Update OGLGraphicsImpl.h
Node::GetChildren is missing in the script API
data.body:
The method Node::GetChildren seems to be not bound in the Lua API. Calling it results in a Lua runtime error and is also not on the generated documentation.

I've checked and the binding is done in Node.pkg.
